config_description: Enables scripted UDFs (JavaScript UDFs). Java UDFs are always enabled, if enable_user_defined_functions is true. Enable this option to be able to use UDFs with "language javascript" or any custom JSR-223 provider. This option has no effect, if enable_user_defined_functions is false.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions' is checked in the code to ensure that scripted user-defined functions are enabled in cassandra.yaml. If the option is not enabled, an InvalidRequestException is thrown with a message prompting to set 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions=true' in the configuration file.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions' is triggered whenever the assertUdfsEnabled method is called with a language other than 'java'. This means that the frequency of triggering depends on the usage of non-java UDFs in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Enabling the 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions' configuration option allows the system to use scripted user-defined functions (JavaScript UDFs). This can introduce security risks, as mentioned in the InvalidRequestException message. The impact of enabling this option is the ability to use UDFs with 'language javascript' or any custom JSR-223 provider, but it is dependent on the overall system security considerations.
